question: You are being tailgated by a driver behind. What should you do?

choices.A: Brake sharply to show your annoyance
choices.B: Speed up to get away from them
choices.C: Increase your following distance from the vehicle in front
choices.D: Switch on your hazard warning lights

explanation: Increasing the gap in front gives you more time to react and allows you to brake more gently

question: What should you do when you see an emergency vehicle with flashing blue lights?

choices.A: Pull over as soon as it is safe to do so
choices.B: Speed up to stay ahead of it
choices.C: Stop in the middle of the road immediately
choices.D: Maintain your speed and stay in your lane

explanation: You must help emergency vehicles by moving out of their way

question: What is the correct way to use your headlights to signal other road users?

choices.A: Flash them to show you are giving way
choices.B: Flash them to show you are annoyed
choices.C: Flash them only to let others know you are there
choices.D: Use them to signal that it is safe for others to emerge

explanation: The Highway Code states that you should only flash your headlights to let other road users know that you are there.

question: When should you use your horn in a built-up area?

choices.A: Between 11:30 PM and 7:00 AM
choices.B: To greet a friend on the pavement
choices.C: To warn others of your presence when it is necessary
choices.D: To signal your frustration at a traffic jam

explanation: The horn should only be used as a warning of danger. It is illegal to use it in built-up areas at night unless a moving vehicle poses a danger.

question: A pedestrian is waiting to cross at a zebra crossing. What should you do?

choices.A: Wave them across to show it is safe
choices.B: Stop and allow them to cross
choices.C: Sound your horn to tell them to hurry up
choices.D: Maintain your speed if they haven't stepped onto the road

explanation: You should be prepared to stop for pedestrians waiting at a zebra crossing and you must stop once they have stepped onto it.

question: You are driving in a slow-moving traffic queue. What should you do before changing lanes?

choices.A: Check your mirrors and signal your intention early
choices.B: Sound your horn to warn other drivers
choices.C: Force your way into the next lane
choices.D: Wait for another driver to flash their lights at you

explanation: In congested traffic

question: How should you react to a driver who is acting aggressively?

choices.A: Shout back at them
choices.B: Follow them to complain
choices.C: Stay calm and do not react to their behavior
choices.D: Gesture at them to show they are wrong

explanation: Road rage is dangerous. Staying calm and ignoring aggression keeps the situation from escalating.

question: What should you do if a driver pulls out in front of you unexpectedly?

choices.A: Sound your horn and flash your lights
choices.B: Brake hard and stay calm
choices.C: Follow them closely to show your disapproval
choices.D: Overtake them immediately

explanation: Anticipate that others will make mistakes. Stay calm and take the necessary action to stay safe.

question: You are following a learner driver who stalls at a junction. What should you do?

choices.A: Sound your horn to encourage them
choices.B: Drive up very close to their rear bumper
choices.C: Be patient and give them time to restart
choices.D: Flash your headlights repeatedly

explanation: Everyone was a learner once. Give them space and time to recover without adding to their pressure.

question: Which type of vehicle should you give extra room to when it is windy?

choices.A: A tractor
choices.B: A high-sided lorry or a cyclist
choices.C: A small car
choices.D: A motorcycle with a sidecar

explanation: Wind can cause large vehicles to drift and can blow cyclists off course. Give them plenty of space.

question: When should you avoid using your horn?

choices.A: Near a hospital or in a built-up area at night
choices.B: On a narrow country lane
choices.C: When approaching a blind bend
choices.D: When a car is reversing into a side road

explanation: To minimize noise pollution

question: What does it mean if a driver flashes their lights at you?

choices.A: They are giving you the right of way
choices.B: They are warning you of a police speed trap
choices.C: They are letting you know they are there
choices.D: They are telling you that your lights are broken

explanation: Do not assume a flash of lights is an invitation to proceed. It simply means they are there.

question: You are turning right into a side road. A pedestrian is already crossing that road. What should you do?

choices.A: Sound your horn so they stop
choices.B: Wait and give way to the pedestrian
choices.C: Drive around them quickly
choices.D: Flash your lights to tell them to hurry

explanation: Pedestrians who have already started crossing a side road have priority.

question: Why should you keep a safe distance from the vehicle in front?

choices.A: To improve your fuel economy
choices.B: To allow you to see further down the road
choices.C: To stop other drivers from overtaking you
choices.D: To make it easier to change the radio

explanation: A good following distance gives you a better view of the road ahead and more time to react to hazards.

question: A car is following you with its high beam lights on. What should you do?

choices.A: Turn your own high beams on to see better
choices.B: Brake hard to tell them to turn them off
choices.C: Flick your interior mirror to the anti-dazzle position
choices.D: Slow down and stop in the middle of the road

explanation: Use the anti-dazzle setting on your mirror to avoid being blinded while maintaining your focus on the road.

question: When is it acceptable to drive on the pavement?

choices.A: When you need to park and the road is narrow
choices.B: When you are turning into a driveway or property
choices.C: When you are in a hurry to get past traffic
choices.D: Never

explanation: You may only cross a pavement to reach a property. Driving on it otherwise is illegal and dangerous to pedestrians.

question: What should you do if you see a bus trying to pull away from a stop?

choices.A: Speed up to pass it before it moves
choices.B: Give way to the bus if it is safe to do so
choices.C: Sound your horn to warn the driver you are there
choices.D: Drive as close as possible to the bus

explanation: You should give priority to buses whenever it is safe to do so to help public transport stay on schedule.

question: You see a person carrying a white cane with a red band. What does this tell you?

choices.A: They are a blind person
choices.B: They are a deaf person
choices.C: They are both deaf and blind
choices.D: They are a senior citizen

explanation: A white cane with a red band indicates that the pedestrian has both hearing and visual impairments.

question: Who has priority at an unmarked crossroads?

choices.A: Traffic coming from the right
choices.B: Traffic on the wider road
choices.C: The driver who is traveling fastest
choices.D: No one has priority

explanation: At an unmarked junction

question: Why should you never wave a pedestrian across the road?

choices.A: They might not see you
choices.B: It may be taken as an invitation to cross when another vehicle is coming
choices.C: It is against the law to wave at pedestrians
choices.D: It makes you look impatient

explanation: Waving can lead a pedestrian into the path of another vehicle that you haven't seen or that hasn't seen them.

question: You are waiting at a junction. A driver on the main road flashes their lights. What should you do?

choices.A: Move out immediately
choices.B: Wait and make sure it is safe before moving
choices.C: Flash your lights back and then go
choices.D: Assume their lights have flickered by mistake

explanation: A flash of lights does not mean the road is safe. You must still perform your own safety checks before emerging.

question: Which of these is a sign of a considerate driver?

choices.A: Using the horn to tell people to move
choices.B: Flashing lights to claim right of way
choices.C: Allowing others to merge in heavy traffic
choices.D: Tailgating to keep traffic moving

explanation: Considerate drivers help the flow of traffic by being patient and allowing others to move when appropriate.

question: What should you do if a driver is following you too closely in the rain?

choices.A: Brake hard to make them stay back
choices.B: Increase your following distance to at least four seconds
choices.C: Turn your rear fog lights on
choices.D: Speed up until they are no longer behind you

explanation: In wet weather

question: How can you help the environment while driving?

choices.A: By accelerating quickly every time
choices.B: By using the air conditioning constantly
choices.C: By looking ahead and driving smoothly
choices.D: By staying in a lower gear

explanation: Smooth driving with less heavy braking and acceleration uses less fuel and reduces emissions.

question: You are driving a slow vehicle on a narrow winding road. What should you do?

choices.A: Maintain your speed and ignore the queue
choices.B: Pull in safely when you can to let others pass
choices.C: Speed up even if it feels unsafe
choices.D: Drive in the middle of the road to prevent overtaking

explanation: Pulling over to let a queue pass prevents other drivers from making risky overtaking maneuvers out of frustration.

question: What is the most common cause of collisions?

choices.A: Mechanical failure
choices.B: Bad weather
choices.C: Poor driver attitude and errors
choices.D: Poor road surfaces

explanation: The majority of accidents are caused by human error

question: When should you use your hazard warning lights while driving?

choices.A: When you are parked illegally
choices.B: To thank another driver
choices.C: To warn traffic behind of a sudden hazard on a motorway
choices.D: When you are driving in heavy rain

explanation: Hazard lights should only be used while moving to warn drivers on a motorway or unrestricted dual carriageway of a hazard ahead.

question: You want to turn right at a box junction. There is oncoming traffic but the exit is clear. What should you do?

choices.A: Wait behind the first line
choices.B: Enter the box and wait for a gap in traffic
choices.C: Drive through even if the exit isn't clear
choices.D: Wait for the lights to change to red

explanation: You are allowed to enter a yellow box junction to wait if you want to turn right and are only stopped by oncoming traffic.

question: What should you do if you see a sheep or a horse on the road?

choices.A: Sound your horn to move them
choices.B: Slow down and be ready to stop
choices.C: Rev your engine to scare them away
choices.D: Flash your lights at the animal

explanation: Animals are unpredictable. Slow down

question: What should you do if an older person is crossing the road in front of you?

choices.A: Flash your lights to warn them
choices.B: Be patient and allow them to finish crossing
choices.C: Sound your horn if they are too slow
choices.D: Drive around them closely

explanation: Older pedestrians may take longer to cross. Give them the time they need without rushing them.

question: A car is stopped at a zebra crossing. Why should you not overtake it?

choices.A: It is illegal to overtake in a town
choices.B: The car might be broken down
choices.C: A pedestrian you can't see may be crossing
choices.D: The driver might be turning right

explanation: Never overtake the vehicle closest to a crossing; they are often stopped for a pedestrian you cannot see yet.

question: What is the best way to handle 'competitive' drivers?

choices.A: Try to beat them at the next set of lights
choices.B: Ignore them and drive safely
choices.C: Block them from changing lanes
choices.D: Follow them to report them

explanation: Don't get drawn into a competition. It only increases the risk of an accident.

question: When are you allowed to use your fog lights?

choices.A: Whenever it is dark
choices.B: Only when visibility is seriously reduced (less than 100m)
choices.C: When it is raining lightly
choices.D: To make your car look better

explanation: Fog lights dazzle other drivers and should only be used in very thick fog or falling snow.

question: You are at a junction and a driver flashes their lights at you. What is the first thing you should do?

choices.A: Move out quickly before they change their mind
choices.B: Check that there are no other hazards or vehicles approaching
choices.C: Flash your lights back as a thank you
choices.D: Assume they are flashing someone else

explanation: You must always verify that the road is clear yourself

question: What should you do if you are driving on a road with parked cars and a car is coming towards you?

choices.A: Speed up to get through first
choices.B: Stop and wait if the obstruction is on your side
choices.C: Sound your horn and keep going
choices.D: Drive onto the pavement to let them past

explanation: If the parked cars are on your side of the road

question: How can you avoid dazzling the driver behind you when stopped in traffic at night?

choices.A: Keep your foot on the brake pedal
choices.B: Use the parking brake (handbrake) and take your foot off the footbrake
choices.C: Turn your lights off
choices.D: Switch to sidelights only

explanation: The bright red glare of brake lights can be very dazzling to drivers behind

question: What should you do if a driver is trying to overtake you?

choices.A: Speed up so they can't get past
choices.B: Maintain your speed or slow down slightly to help them
choices.C: Move to the right to block them
choices.D: Sound your horn to warn them off

explanation: Be helpful. If someone wants to pass

question: You are entering a roundabout. Who should you generally give way to?

choices.A: Traffic from the left
choices.B: Traffic already on the roundabout from the right
choices.C: No one,  it is first come first served
choices.D: Only buses and lorries

explanation: You should generally give way to traffic already in the roundabout coming from your right, unless signs or markings tell you otherwise.

question: What should you do if you realize you are in the wrong lane at a busy roundabout?

choices.A: Cut across the traffic to the correct exit
choices.B: Stop and wait for a gap
choices.C: Continue to the next exit or go all the way around
choices.D: Reverse to the previous junction

explanation: Changing lanes suddenly on a roundabout is dangerous. Just go around again or find a safe way back later.

question: How should you drive when passing a school?

choices.A: At the maximum speed limit to get past quickly
choices.B: With extra caution and at a lower speed
choices.C: Sounding your horn to warn children
choices.D: Following the car in front very closely

explanation: Schools are high-risk areas for children. Slow down and stay extremely alert.

question: A cyclist is signaling to turn right at a large roundabout. What should you do?

choices.A: Overtake them on the right
choices.B: Give them plenty of room and stay behind them
choices.C: Sound your horn to tell them to move over
choices.D: Flash your lights to tell them to go

explanation: Cyclists may stay in the left-hand lane even when turning right. Give them the space to do so safely.

question: What is the main benefit of being a patient driver?

choices.A: You will arrive at your destination faster
choices.B: It reduces stress and makes the road safer for everyone
choices.C: It makes your car last longer
choices.D: You will never get a speeding fine

explanation: Patience reduces the likelihood of making mistakes or causing road rage.

question: What should you do if you are being dazzled by the sun?

choices.A: Speed up to get into the shade
choices.B: Use your sun visor and wear sunglasses if necessary
choices.C: Close your eyes for a second
choices.D: Stop in the middle of the road

explanation: Be prepared for sun glare

question: A driver pulls up alongside you and starts shouting. What should you do?

choices.A: Shout back at them
choices.B: Keep your windows closed and avoid eye contact
choices.C: Get out of the car to see what is wrong
choices.D: Follow them to see where they are going

explanation: Avoiding confrontation is the best way to deal with road rage.

question: When may you use your hazard warning lights to thank someone?

choices.A: Only when you are on a motorway
choices.B: It is not recommended; a brief wave is better
choices.C: Whenever you feel like it
choices.D: When it is dark

explanation: Hazard lights are for warning of danger

question: What should you do if you are waiting to emerge from a side road and your view is blocked by parked cars?

choices.A: Pull out quickly and hope for the best
choices.B: Creep forward slowly until you can see clearly
choices.C: Wait for someone to flash their lights
choices.D: Ask a passenger to run out and check

explanation: Moving forward very slowly allows you to see without putting your car in danger.

question: Which of these is most likely to cause a distraction?

choices.A: Listening to the radio at a low volume
choices.B: Using a hand-held mobile phone
choices.C: Checking your mirrors
choices.D: Using your windscreen wipers

explanation: Hand-held phones are a major source of physical and mental distraction.

question: How can you show consideration for a horse and rider?

choices.A: Speed up to get past them quickly
choices.B: Pass wide and slow
choices.C: Sound your horn as you pass
choices.D: Flash your headlights to let them know you are there

explanation: Horses are easily spooked. Pass them with as much room as possible and at a very low speed.

question: What should you do if you are following a learner and they are driving very slowly?

choices.A: Tailgate them to make them go faster
choices.B: Be patient and stay back
choices.C: Overtake them on a blind bend
choices.D: Sound your horn repeatedly

explanation: Learners need space and patience to build their confidence.

question: You are at a railway level crossing. The red lights continue to flash after a train has passed. What should you do?

choices.A: Drive across quickly
choices.B: Wait, as another train may be coming
choices.C: Get out and check the tracks
choices.D: Sound your horn to warn others

explanation: If the lights continue to flash, it means another train is approaching.  You must stay behind the stop line until the lights go out.

question: What does 'dry steering' mean?

choices.A: Steering while the car is moving
choices.B: Steering while the car is stationary
choices.C: Steering without using the indicators
choices.D: Steering with only one hand

explanation: Turning the steering wheel while the car is not moving causes unnecessary wear to the tyres and steering mechanism.

question: Why should you never follow a large vehicle too closely?

choices.A: It makes it easier to overtake
choices.B: The driver cannot see you in their mirrors
choices.C: You will get better fuel economy
choices.D: It protects your car from the wind

explanation: If you can't see the driver's mirrors

question: What should you do if a driver flashes their headlights at you at night?

choices.A: Flash yours back
choices.B: Check your own lights are on and not on high beam
choices.C: Turn your lights off briefly
choices.D: Stop immediately

explanation: They may be trying to tell you that your own lights are dazzling them or that you have forgotten to turn them on.

question: You are driving on a dual carriageway. A car is joined from a slip road. What should you do?

choices.A: Maintain your speed and stay in your lane
choices.B: Move to the right-hand lane if it is safe to do so
choices.C: Speed up to block them
choices.D: Brake hard to let them in

explanation: Helping others to merge safely improves the flow of traffic for everyone.

question: What should you do if you have to pull up on a pavement to allow an emergency vehicle through?

choices.A: Drive as fast as you can
choices.B: Be careful not to endanger any pedestrians
choices.C: Stay there until the police arrive
choices.D: Keep your hazard lights on for the rest of the day

explanation: Pedestrians are the most vulnerable road users. Even in an emergency

question: How can you prevent your car from being a nuisance to others?

choices.A: By using a loud exhaust
choices.B: By parking in a way that doesn't block driveways or pavements
choices.C: By playing music very loudly
choices.D: By using your horn to say goodbye

explanation: Considerate parking is a key part of being a good driver.
